text.title: Aberaeron
text.head: Aberaeron
text.p: Aberaeron is a coastal town in Ceredigion, Wales.
text.head: Understand
text.p: Aberaeron is a Welsh-speaking seaside town, with multicoloured houses, a harbour and many small independent shops.
text.head: Get in
text.p: There is no train station. The nearest is in Aberystwyth, from where there are buses. By road, the main A487 runs through the town.
text.head: Get around
text.p: It's about a 20 minute drive to Aberystwyth. To the south there are good beaches at Llangrannog and Cwmtydu.
text.head: See

list.item: The town and harbour. Aberaeron is well known for its multicoloured houses and buildings. Take a stroll down the High Street and around the harbour. Look out for the local family of Bottle-nosed Dolphins out to sea.
Llanerchaeron, Ciliau Aeron, SA48 8DG (2.5 miles southeast), ☏ +44 1545 570200 , ✉ llanerchaeron@nationaltrust.org.uk . 18th-century Welsh gentry estate - with house, walled gardens and home farm

text.head: Do

list.item: Ceredigion Coast Path . Aberaeron and Aberarth are on the path. Walk along the cliff tops as far as you please.

text.head: Buy

list.item: Cegin Cymru (Welsh Kitchen), 18 Market Street. Lovely little shop selling locally-produced delicacies. The farmhouse cheeses are a particular favourite.
Aeron Sports, 2 Alban Square. Fishing tackle and other sports gear

Book Worm (Gwisgo Bookworm), 8 Sgwar Alban, SA46 0AD, ☏ +44 1545 238282 , ✉ info@gwisgo.co.uk . A good selection of Welsh and English books. Plenty at the more intellectual end of the spectrum. Free parking nearby.

text.head: Eat

list.item: Harbourmaster Hotel (Gwesty'r Harbwr), 2 Quay Parade, ☏ +44 1545 570755 . has a superb restaurant, specialising in seafood
New Celtic, 8 Market Street, ☏ +44 1545 570369 . fish-and-chips and more restaurant (eat in or take away), tasty and substantial meal
The Hive on the Quay, Cadwgan Pl (exactly where the name implies), ☏ +44 1545 570445 . The Famous Holgate's Honey Ice Cream. Also holds a cafe/restaurant serving more substantial meals.

Friends Coffee Shop, 5 Alban Square, ☏ +44 1545 571122 . A great cafe/takeaway specialising in baguettes and Segafredo coffee. Great quality food at very reasonable prices with a warm and friendly atmosphere.
La Cuccina, 35 Alban Square, ☏ +44 1545 571012 . little bakery.

text.head: Drink
Sleep

list.item: The Harbourmaster Hotel (Gwesty'r Harbwr), Pen Cei (1 Quay Parade), ☏ +44 1545 570755 . A cobalt blue small hotel with views of the sea and harbour. £80-£120 per night for bed and breakfast.

Nant Meigan (Holiday Home), 9 Water Street, ☏ +44 7971 282007 . A Grade 2 listed Georgian terrace holiday let, in the centre of the town. A five minute walk to the pebble beach, and backing onto the river Aeron, the property enjoys a walled garden.
